info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 27 at 12:48PM MST until September 27 at 2:45PM MST by NWS Phoenix AZ
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of southwest Arizona, including the following county, Yuma and southeast California, including the following county, Imperial.
* WHEN...Until 245 PM MST /245 PM PDT/.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1248 PM MST /1248 PM PDT/, local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Senator Wash, Colorado River, Mission Wash, Unnamed Wash, Picacho Wash and Araz Wash. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Yuma, Winterhaven and Andrade. - This includes CA Interstate 8 between mile markers 90 and 96. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM MST /245 PM PDT/ THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING
